result.execSummary:
The defendant Morgan L Gaetz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to the Clerk of Courts Office- 60 days to pay or set up payment plan. Failure to do so will be warrant.
Must provide DNA sample & pay surcharge of $250.00. Defendant to stop at jail today.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

Not to have abusive contact with: Lisa Gaetz. 
Not to have contact with: Matthew McCarty, Donovan Nickell or Emily Thorud. 
Not to have abusive contact with: Steven Leisch. 
No illegal substances, no paraphernalia. 
Not to possess or consume alcohol.
Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion.
Cannot vote or hold public office.
Defendant is eligible for expungment; Clerk of Courts Office to expunge if eligible after successful completion of probation.

Defendant must complete HSED within first year of probation.
If not a US Citizen, may be deported.
AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.

timeConds.notes: To be used by agent if necessary.
Must complete 25 hours per year of probation for a total of 75 hours.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Morgan L Gaetz in court.  Daniel Joseph Tolan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. RL/KJB- Clerk. 1:36 pm. Def- request to modify bond. State does not object to no abusive contact. CT grants modifying no contact with Steven Leisch to no abusive contact with Steven Leisch. No longer need to go through mother for child related matters. COCC to amend judgment of conviction. 1:41 pm adj.

2:47 Defendant Morgan L Gaetz in court.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  JP-clerk  Ct reviews file.  DE looking at dropping NC.  Ct - this is a sentencing order - will refer to Judge MEG for modification.  2:51 adj.

Prior: 844 100th Street, Amery, WI 54001 United States

Info filed. Def- plea of G to Ct 2. Parties waive PSI.  CT- accepts plea, finds G of Ct 2 in 15CF76, enters JOC. CT DRI Ct 1 and 3 in 15CF76, dismissing outright 15CF167.

SENTENCING on Ct 2 in 15CF76: w/h sent, prob- 3 yrs- appear today, No abusive contact w/ Lisa Gaetz, No contact with Matthew McCarty, Donovan Nickell or Emily Thorud, No contact with Steven Leisch other than through his mother, Christine Ledin, for child related matters, No illegal substance, no alcol, sub to testing, AODA & comply, bank 120 days jail to be used by agent if necessary, 25 hrs CS per year= total of 75 hrs, must complete HSED within first year of probation, $290.60 fine/cost, Cannot possess firearm or body armor, cannot vote or hold public office, if not US Citizen, could be deported, DNA sample & $250 surcharge- stop at jail today, eligible for expungment- COCC to expunge if eligible after successful completion of probation.
